text: Hi all! Does anyone have any suggestions for a user looking to pull images into an abandoned cart email: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Content-Design-Questions/Product-Image-for-Abandoned-Cart-Emails/m-p/218255> any tips, suggestions or workarounds would be great!! Thank you!
havent done any ecomm integrations, yet.  very curious

I'm actually looking at this line in their code:
`{% email_each list="deal.line_items" item="line_item" %}`

what is `email_each` ? i havent seen that var before <@U22PJPGK0> is this something you can do in email?
what does it print out? all of a contacts deals?
no clue, when we've done the AC stuff, we just pass one image url to the users contact record and then assign it to the image `src` attribute
so this is new to me
perhaps <@U6W3H6YN8> may have insight as well

Emails are rendered twice, once using HubL, and then again for each recipient. This is used to ensure that for the second render, it can iterate safely over the items in a list. Hopefully this will go away at some point.
cool to know, thanks for the insight Jeff
Maybe <@UCH1L597V> who does a lot of work with both email and ecommerce?

Hi All, I am not sure if this is the correct channel to ask my question, but hopefully you can help me with about it. Is there a way to check up in HubSpot how many times a given URL was shared? Something that, allows you to enter any URL to find out how many times it was shared on Twitter, Facebook, Google+, and LinkedIn. Sorry, I know I have opened the same question to the HubSpot community (<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Blog-Website-Page-Publishing/Is-there-a-tool-or-module-in-HubSpot-that-shows-how-many-times-a/m-p/218674#M2044>), but I am hoping I can get a direct answer from here. Or if there is a channel you can recommend that I can ask this question? Thanks in advance :blush:
